import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.2351c737:
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
wcss = []

for i in range(1, 11):
    kmean = KMeans(n_clusters = i, random_state = 42)
    kmean.fit(x)
    wcss.append(kmean.inertia_)

plt.plot(range(1, 11), wcss, marker = 'o')
plt.xlabel('WCSS value')
plt.ylabel('Number of clusters')
plt.title('Number of clusters V/S WCSS values')
plt.show()

plt.scatter(x['Annual Income (k$)'][y_predict==0], x['Spending Score (1-100)'][y_predict==0], s=100, c = 'red', label = 'Cluster 1')  
plt.scatter(x['Annual Income (k$)'][y_predict==1], x['Spending Score (1-100)'][y_predict==1], s=100, c = 'blue', label = 'Cluster 2') 
plt.scatter(x['Annual Income (k$)'][y_predict==2], x['Spending Score (1-100)'][y_predict==2], s=100, c = 'green', label = 'Cluster 3') 
plt.scatter(x['Annual Income (k$)'][y_predict==3], x['Spending Score (1-100)'][y_predict==3], s=100, c = 'magenta', label = 'Cluster 4') 
plt.scatter(x['Annual Income (k$)'][y_predict==4], x['Spending Score (1-100)'][y_predict==4], s=100, c = 'cyan', label = 'Cluster 5') 

plt.scatter(kmean.cluster_centers_[:, 0], kmean.cluster_centers_[:, 1], s = 300, c = 'yellow', label = 'Centroid')   
plt.title('Clusters of customers')  
plt.xlabel('Annual Income (k$)')  
plt.ylabel('Spending Score (1-100)')  
plt.legend()  
plt.show()
